intro: Cabucala madagascariensis var. acuta, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellow-orange cyathia. The plant is typically shrub-like, with branched stems and a compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
